verses.verse: but the field, (Lev. 25:10, 28, 31) when it is released in the Jubilee, shall be holy to the LORD, as a (Lev. 27:28) devoted field; it shall be (Num. 18:14; Ezek. 44:29) the possession of the priest.
‘And if a man dedicates to the LORD a field which he has bought, which is not the field of (Lev. 25:10, 25) his possession,
then the priest shall reckon to him the worth of your valuation, up to the Year of Jubilee, and he shall give your valuation on that day as a holy offering to the LORD.
(Lev. 25:10-13, 28) In the Year of Jubilee the field shall return to him from whom it was bought, to the one who owned the land as a possession.
And all your valuations shall be according to the shekel of the sanctuary: (Ex. 30:13; Lev. 27:3; Num. 3:47; 18:16; Ezek. 45:12) twenty gerahs to the shekel.
‘But the (Ex. 13:2, 12; 22:30) firstborn of the animals, which should be the LORD’s firstborn, no man shall dedicate; whether it is an ox or sheep, it is the LORD’s.

And if it is an unclean animal, then he shall redeem it according to your valuation, and (Lev. 27:11, 12) shall add one-fifth to it; or if it is not redeemed, then it shall be sold according to your valuation.

(Lev. 27:21; Num. 18:14; Josh. 6:17-19) ‘Nevertheless no devoted offering that a man may devote to the LORD of all that he has, both man and beast, or the field of his possession, shall be sold or redeemed; every devoted offering is most holy to the LORD.
(Num. 21:2) No person under the ban, who may become doomed to destruction among men, shall be redeemed, but shall surely be put to death.

And (Gen. 28:22; Num. 18:21, 24; 2 Chr. 31:5, 6, 12; Neh. 13:12; Mal. 3:8) all the tithe of the land, whether of the seed of the land or of the fruit of the tree, is the LORD’s. It is holy to the LORD.
(Lev. 27:13) If a man wants at all to redeem any of his tithes, he shall add one-fifth to it.
And concerning the tithe of the herd or the flock, of whatever (Jer. 33:13; Ezek. 20:37; Mic. 7:14) passes under the rod, the tenth one shall be holy to the LORD.

He shall not inquire whether it is good or bad, (Lev. 27:10) nor shall he exchange it; and if he exchanges it at all, then both it and the one exchanged for it shall be holy; it shall not be redeemed.’ ”
(Lev. 26:46; Deut. 4:5; Mal. 4:4) These are the commandments which the LORD commanded Moses for the children of Israel on Mount (Ex. 19:1-6, 25; (Heb. 12:18-29)) Sinai.

(The First Census of Israel) Now the LORD spoke to Moses (Ex. 19:1; Num. 10:11, 12) in the Wilderness of Sinai, (Ex. 25:22) in the tabernacle of meeting, on the (Ex. 40:2, 17; Num. 9:1; 10:11) first day of the second month, in the second year after they had come out of the land of Egypt, saying:

(Ex. 30:12; Num. 26:2, 63, 64; 2 Sam. 24:2; 1 Chr. 21:2) “Take a census of all the congregation of the children of Israel, by their families, by their fathers’ houses, according to the number of names, every male (Ex. 30:12, 13; 38:26) individually,
from (Ex. 30:14; 38:26) twenty years old and above—all who are able to go to war in Israel. You and Aaron shall number them by their armies.
And with you there shall be a man from every tribe, each one the head of his father’s house.
“These are the names of the men who shall stand with you: from Reuben, Elizur the son of Shedeur;
from Simeon, Shelumiel the son of Zurishaddai;
from Judah, Nahshon the son of Amminadab;
from Issachar, Nethanel the son of Zuar;
from Zebulun, Eliab the son of Helon;
from the sons of Joseph: from Ephraim, Elishama the son of Ammihud; from Manasseh, Gamaliel the son of Pedahzur;
from Benjamin, Abidan the son of Gideoni;
from Dan, Ahiezer the son of Ammishaddai;
from Asher, Pagiel the son of Ocran;
from Gad, Eliasaph the son of (Num. 7:42) Deuel;
from Naphtali, Ahira the son of Enan.”

(Ex. 18:21; Num. 7:2; 1 Chr. 27:16-22) These were (Num. 16:2) chosen from the congregation, leaders of their fathers’ tribes, (Ex. 18:21, 25; Jer. 5:5; Mic. 3:1, 9; 5:2) heads of the divisions in Israel.
Then Moses and Aaron took these men who had been mentioned (Is. 43:1) by name,

and they assembled all the congregation together on the first day of the second month; and they recited their (Ezra 2:59; Heb. 7:3) ancestry by families, by their fathers’ houses, according to the number of names, from twenty years old and above, each one individually.
As the LORD commanded Moses, so he numbered them in the Wilderness of Sinai.

Now the (Num. 2:10, 11; 26:5-11; 32:6, 15, 21, 29) children of Reuben, Israel’s oldest son, their genealogies by their families, by their fathers’ house, according to the number of names, every male individually, from twenty years old and above, all who were able to go to war:
those who were numbered of the tribe of Reuben were forty-six thousand five hundred.

From the (Num. 2:12, 13; 26:12-14) children of Simeon, their genealogies by their families, by their fathers’ house, of those who were numbered, according to the number of names, every male individually, from twenty years old and above, all who were able to go to war:
those who were numbered of the tribe of Simeon were fifty-nine thousand three hundred.

From the (Gen. 30:11; Num. 26:15-18; Josh. 4:12; Jer. 49:1) children of Gad, their genealogies by their families, by their fathers’ house, according to the number of names, from twenty years old and above, all who were able to go to war:
those who were numbered of the tribe of Gad were forty-five thousand six hundred and fifty.

From the (Gen. 29:35; Num. 26:19-22; 2 Sam. 24:9; Ps. 78:68; Matt. 1:2) children of Judah, their genealogies by their families, by their fathers’ house, according to the number of names, from twenty years old and above, all who were able to go to war:
those who were numbered of the tribe of Judah were (2 Chr. 17:14) seventy-four thousand six hundred.

From the (Num. 2:5, 6) children of Issachar, their genealogies by their families, by their fathers’ house, according to the number of names, from twenty years old and above, all who were able to go to war:
those who were numbered of the tribe of Issachar were fifty-four thousand four hundred.

From the (Num. 2:7, 8; 26:26, 27) children of Zebulun, their genealogies by their families, by their fathers’ house, according to the number of names, from twenty years old and above, all who were able to go to war:
those who were numbered of the tribe of Zebulun were fifty-seven thousand four hundred.

From the sons of Joseph, the (Gen. 48:1-22; Num. 26:28-37; Deut. 33:13-17; Jer. 7:15; Obad. 19) children of Ephraim, their genealogies by their families, by their fathers’ house, according to the number of names, from twenty years old and above, all who were able to go to war:
those who were numbered of the tribe of Ephraim were forty thousand five hundred.

From the (Num. 2:20, 21; 26:28-34) children of Manasseh, their genealogies by their families, by their fathers’ house, according to the number of names, from twenty years old and above, all who were able to go to war:
those who were numbered of the tribe of Manasseh were thirty-two thousand two hundred.

From the (Gen. 49:27; Num. 26:38-41; 2 Chr. 17:17; Rev. 7:8) children of Benjamin, their genealogies by their families, by their fathers’ house, according to the number of names, from twenty years old and above, all who were able to go to war:
those who were numbered of the tribe of Benjamin were thirty-five thousand four hundred.

From the (Gen. 30:6; 46:23; Num. 2:25, 26; 26:42, 43) children of Dan, their genealogies by their families, by their fathers’ house, according to the number of names, from twenty years old and above, all who were able to go to war:
those who were numbered of the tribe of Dan were sixty-two thousand seven hundred.

From the (Num. 2:27, 28; 26:44-47) children of Asher, their genealogies by their families, by their fathers’ house, according to the number of names, from twenty years old and above, all who were able to go to war:
